content: It is better to focus on negotiating for one or two benefits at a time rather than asking for everything at once. While it's great to be ambitious, it's important to be realistic and strategic about your requests. Negotiating for too many things at once can make your employer feel overwhelmed and lead to a negative outcome. Focus on the benefits that are most important to you and that you feel will have the most significant impact on your overall job satisfaction and performance. The goal is to present your requests in a way that will make your employer see the value of these benefits and perceive their value as small compared to the benefits they will receive from your improved performance. Once you have successfully negotiated one or two benefits, you can use that success to build on and negotiate for additional benefits in the future. The key is always to approach negotiations with a positive attitude, mutual respect for the other party, and realistic expectations.
